data.title: Improper rendering of unicode surrogate pairs in terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18| |python|donjayamanne|0.5.2| |ocaml|hackwaly|0.6.9| |haskell-linter|hoovercj|0.0.6| |vscode-ghc-mod|hoovercj|1.0.1| |language-haskell|justusadam|1.2.2| |vscode-clang|mitaki28|0.2.1| --- The terminal seems to render both characters of a surrogate pair instead of rendering it as a single glyph. This causes alignment issues in my ncurses-based project (not a blocker, just something odd I noticed). See screenshot

data.title: Feature Request: A Singular Configuration Definition
data.body:
I suspect I'm not unique in that I work on multiple computers. I have my windows based work computer (ug!) and my personal mac. I want to use the same editor on all and invest time tweaking the config so that it's just right. But keeping multiple computers in sync is impossible. I'll make a tweak to one, but inevitably forget to transfer that to the other. 

So, it would be SUPER SWEET if a change to one computer sync'd with all my others. A single configuration definition.

data.title: Reopen files after a restart (same as for "window.reopenFolders")
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some files. Not a folder. Just some plain source code files (`Ctrl + O`)
2. Make some changes with them. Save. Don't close files. Close the editor.
3. Open the editor and observe one brand new `Untitled-1` tab only. But where are my previous files? Why were not they opened?

There is a `window.reopenFolders` option. Ok, it is not a bad option. But how about files? How about those devs who do not use folders? I never open folders. Lack of this feature in VSCode is annoying. ST3 has it so I'm compelled to use it.

data.title: Find and replace limited to 999 lines?
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.7.1 - OS Version: 10.12.1 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a file with an excessive amount of duplicates, in my case - 19000 line CSV with `,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,` 2. `cmd+shit+h` or `edit -> replace` 3. Using replace all will only select the first 999 occurrences I assume this is a performance constraint, so this may not be an issue at all. However, it makes a monthly task of mine consume more time or I have to use another editor - which I would prefer not to.

data.title: [css] option to hide all CSS vendor prefixes in intellisense
data.body: A lot of people now use Post CSS autoprefixer rather than going to the bother of manually writing out prefixes themselves. It's a far better workflow. As such, prefixes being in-your-face as code auto-completion suggestions is a very annoying feature of VSCode. Is there an easy way to remove prefixes from appearing in the code-completion suggestions? If there is not then there should be.

data.title: Display gitignored files/folders in gray (inactive) color (in left explorer tree)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Even that GIT integration is good in @code but in explorer it's not possible to see which **files are marked as ignored** and will not be pushed to git.
In other editors these ignored files are **displayed in gray** - so you know which are not relevant to edit (eg. some generated files, configs etc).

Probably best would be if icon themes for explorer will have ability to change look of this feature.

Example in phpstorm:
![Example in phpstorm](https://screen.jurosh.com/i16/2016_11_20_72261702821567312.png)

..having .gitignore:
```
vendor
.env
```

data.title: Copy lines (Up/Down) doesn't work on Ubuntu for me !

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hey,

I can't get copy lines (Up/Down) functionality to work on Ubuntu, I don't know exactly why. Obviously, I tried `ctrl+shift+alt+down/up` but nothing happens!

It does work when I change the key mapping (i.e. `shift+alt-down/up`), though.

May be it worth mentioning that I have installed Ubuntu few days ago, so any setting or something are on its default.

- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Just have some text in VS Code.
2.  Press `ctrl+shift+alt+down` or `ctrl+shift+alt+up`.

data.title: doubling of accented foreign characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (9b06d4392aeac3af2e9da58838a518bba325d23a, 2016-11-18T08:59:27.025Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.1.10|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|Theme-MarkdownKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|wordcount|ms-vscode|0.1.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. on a mac switch to the greek keyboard
2. press the two-key combination to produce the accented version of any vowel of the greek alphabet (e.g. ά, έ, ί, ό, ή, ύ, ώ)
3. you get the expected accented character
4. now press any other character or space
5. you get another copy of the accented character, followed by the character you just entered

This behaviour first appeared very recently (no more than a week, I would say) and renders VS Code nearly unusable. I'll try to check if it is also happens on Windows.

Thanks in advance for your attention

data.title: In markdown ligature works for `<-` only if it is backtick quoted.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

    "editor.fontFamily": "'Inziu Iosevka CL'",
    "editor.fontLigatures": true

In `markdown` language, `<-` forms a ligature only if it is quoted by backtick. (I guess it is the color that triggers ligature?) However `->` works well.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1499555/20459467/28f9256c-aeba-11e6-8b80-78d048a185f8.PNG)

@be5invis

data.title: Cursor doesn't move in a redo operation

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.7.1 - OS Version: Win 10 AU 1) Any text file, cursor positioned between the two 'l's of hello 2) Extension does an edit operation, eg `edit.insert(new vscode.Position(0, 0), "*")`. Cursor moves with the text as expected 3) Ctrl+Z to undo, cursor moves back, as expected 4) Ctrl+Y to redo, would expect cursor to move back to the same position as in 2), but it doesn't move

data.title: DEbug console link detection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.1 (1.7.1)
- OS Version: Mac os X 10,11,4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run mocha tests with configuration like that :
```
        {
            "name": "MesTests",
            "type": "node",
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "unit_test",
                "MONGO_URI":"cedric:cedric01@localhost:27017/unitTests?authSource=add_gen",
                "DEBUG":"tests,renderer"
            },
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "args": ["test/register.js"],
            "outDir": null
        },
```
2.  Debug output on error is like this :

```
     Uncaught TypeError: postInstance.setValue is not a function
      at model.newPostInstance (schemas/**customerSchema.ts:1870:22**)
      at schemas**/customerSchema.ts:1915:26**
      at tryCatcher (node_modules/**bluebird/js/release/util.js:16:23**)
```

I have put between **  the underlined lines, the first part is not. Result is it is not possible to click on the links. Maybe a bad setting on my side, but i was unable to find how to change that issue, all the first subdirectories of my project are not underlined, means not integrated in the link.

data.title: Editor option for more strict highlighting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

I would like to ask for an **editor option** to enable stricter and/or more intelligent highlighting.

What I mean is this: whenever I click on any name or string, it attempts to highlight all occurences of it in the code. Usually it highlights too many of them:
![prav](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11004850/20456649/8e41363a-ae9c-11e6-9504-f3e95205bde3.png)

I would like it to check for exact match, so in this example there would be no other occurences selected.

Also, would be good to disable this occurence highlighting for strings/parts of strings, so it doesn't do this:
![otr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11004850/20456689/28d312cc-ae9d-11e6-91fb-33228ecba8d8.png)

Hopefully it's within the scope of this feature request as well.

Thanks for all your work.

data.title: Allow extensions to publish beta releases and users to opt-in to them

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Apologies if this has come up before; I'm unable to find any related issues.

It would be cool to be able to publish extensions in a beta form (similar to Code Insiders) so that they can be run "in production" with real users that have opted-in. This would reduce the disk in publishing an extension because you can push it to a smaller number of users for testing (I probably don't need to sell this to you, I guess you have Insiders for very similar reasons).

I know we can package and distribute extensions ourselves for now, but it's not as easy (eg. updating is not automatic).

I originally thought the "Preview" flag might've provided this functionality but unless I've overlooked something, it does not seem to.

data.title: Crash reporting: include crash details
data.body:
Would it be possible to add the actual details of the crash dump to the crash page so that we get an idea what kind of crashes are happening? I think it would be cool if we could:
* group crashes by crash details
* try to find similarities from the telemetry in terms of user interaction

I guess depending on the OS we would need different strategies to extract the actual error from the dump, but I think we do this already for the crash telemetry drashboard if I remember correctly.
